abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the First Edo State
            Growth and Employment Support Credit Project for Nigeria is
            to support Edo state's critical reforms for improving
            the management of public resources and creating a better
            environment for growth and employment creation in a
            socially-accountable way. The extension is necessary to
            provide the Edo State Government with adequate time to
            utilize the credit as the approval of Nigeria's
            2012-2015 external borrowing plan by the National Assembly
            was delayed and only came through as part of the 2013-2015
            External Borrowing Plan in December, 2012. This has resulted
            in a delay of the signing of the credit agreements and
            declaration of credit effectiveness. The Edo State
            Government is fully committed to the objectives of the
            Development Policy Operation (DPO). This will be the first
            extension of the project.
